abstract.text: Change the characteristics of in-flight audio by adjusting its properties at runtime.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Metaparameters control several features of a sound source or sound event, as they play back. For instance, metaparameters can adjust a switch node’s toggle, or the amount of reverb that a sound source emanates.

content.text: Attach Metaparameters to a Particular Sound

inlineContent.text: To use a metaparameter, you attach it to a sound event or sound source. PHASE provides the following ways to attach metaparameters:

content.text: Adjust a Property of a Single Audio Signal

inlineContent.text: The framework refers to metaparameters that you access through a sound event’s
metaparameters. When you adjust the value of a local metaparameter, it affects just the sound event.
The following code changes the volume on a specific sound event:

code: // Create a sampler node that plays an audio file named "mySound".
// Attach the metaparameter to the sampler node.
// Access the local metaparameter and change the gain.
// Create a sampler node that plays an audio file named "mySound".
// Attach the metaparameter to the sampler node.
// Access the local metaparameter and change the gain.

content.text: Share a Parameter with Multiple Audio Signals

inlineContent.text: The framework refers to parameters that affect many sound events or sound sources as
metaparameters. Real-time adjustments to global metaparameters affect the playback of all sound events that initialize with the metaparameter.
metaparameter for all of its associated sound events:

code: // Register it as a global metaparameter.
fatalError("Unable to register the weather metaparameter.")
// Attach it to a sound event node definition.
// Change the its value at runtime.
// Register it as a global metaparameter.
// Attach it to a sound event node definition.
// Change the its value at runtime.

inlineContent.text: As part of the engine’s asset registry, the
dictionary affects every playing sound event that shares a metaparameter that the dictionary contains.

abstract.text: Create dynamic audio experiences in your game or app that react to events and cues in the environment.
A dictionary of metaparameters that all sound event assets share.
A node that smoothly fades between the audio of its child nodes.
Creates a blend node with a maxiumum blend range value.
Options that apply a mathematical function to an input value.
A collection of segments that connect to graph a complex curve over a linear input.
A curved portion of an envelope.
A base class for nodes that provide audio data to generate sound.
A meta parameter that dynamically changes the audio’s loudness.
A meta parameter that dynamically changes the audio’s rate.
A reference to a registered metaparameter that the app can share with multiple sound events or sources.
A metaparameter that graphs an input value on a set of mathematical curves.
Creates a specification for a named metaparameter that the app plots on a graph defined by the given set of curves.
A named parameter with a value that the app can change over time.
A specification for a named parameter with a constant value.
An object to initialize a mixer with a given configuration.
A template for a parameter that changes the mixer’s volume gradually over a period of time.
A metaparameter defined by a number that can change over time.
A specification for a metaparameter defined by a number.
An ordered pair that defines a bounding box for an envelope.
The object’s meta parameters.
An audio layer with an adjustable volume for a spatial mixer’s output.
A parameter that gradually updates the amount of audio signal that passes through to the output.
A metaparameter with a text definition that can change over time.
A specification for a metaparameter defined by text.
A node that passes invocation to only one of its child nodes.
Creates a node that invokes a child node based on the value of the given parameter.
